section_role=\"main-content\":
The issue in the code snippet is that the value of the role attribute is not valid. The correct value should be "main". Here's the corrected code snippet:

```html
<section role="main">
```
aside_role=\"right-content\":
The issue in this code snippet is that the role attribute has an invalid value "right-content". To fix this, you should use a valid ARIA role. Assuming the aside element is meant to be complementary content, you can use the "complementary" role.

Here's the corrected version of the code snippet:

```html
<aside role="complementary">
```
fieldset_role=\"radio-group\":
The issue in the provided code snippet is that the `role` attribute has an invalid value "radio-group". The correct value should be "radiogroup". Here's the corrected version of the code snippet:

```
<fieldset name="..." role="radiogroup">
```
div_role=\"pagination\":
The issue in the given code snippet is that the `role` attribute has an invalid value "pagination". The correct value should be "navigation". Here is the corrected version of the code snippet:

```
<div aria-label="..." role="navigation">
```
